<p>Are you using programming languages such as R or Python? Are you, or your collaborators, sometimes struggling to get the same results on a different computer?</p><p>Are you still searching for an optimal way to keep track of your computational environments and packages versions?</p><p>In this session, we will discuss the benefits of reproducible computational environments and share tips on how to use the most common environment management tools.</p><p><strong>Possible beginner resources to prepare your session’s hack:</strong></p><ul>
<li>
<a href="https://osf.io/xp9zn/">https://osf.io/xp9zn/</a> (8 mins demo to various tools, e.g. renv, conda, docker, binder)</li>
<li>Using binder with quarto: <a href="https://quarto.org/docs/projects/binder.html">https://quarto.org/docs/projects/binder.html</a>
</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Sessions’ agenda:</strong></p><ul>
<li>Brief round of introductions and description of the problems you’ll be working on during that session</li>
<li>Formation of possible groups or tandems, if participants have tips to exchange on certain topics</li>
<li>Hack</li>
<li>Wrap-up: progress and next steps</li>
</ul>
<p>Learn more about the Hacky Hour initiative <a href="../../meetups/hackyhour/index.html" title="Hacky Hour">here</a>.</p><p> </p><div class="g-clear"></div>
